definition: capable of destroying or eating away by chemical action : corrosive
examples: The chemical was so caustic that it ate through the pipe.

definition: relating to or being the surface or curve of a caustic (see caustic entry 2 sense 2)
a substance that burns or destroys organic tissue by chemical action
a strong corrosive alkali (such as sodium hydroxide)
the envelope of rays emanating from a point and reflected or refracted by a curved surface
